Review Title: The most impressive aspect was the excellent service
Negative Reviews: The only thing that could be improved is the addition of a game zone or play area for children.
Positive Reviews:
I had an overall great experience at the Novotel Hotel. The most impressive aspect was the excellent service the staff provided, who were attentive and efficient. The service was quick, and the facilities, including food and cleanliness, were outstanding.

However, as a vegetarian, I found that the North Indian vegetarian options were limited compared to the numerous non-vegetarian choices, even in the buffet. Despite this, the service was excellent, and I preferred opting for the buffet rather than individual orders as it offered better value for the same price.

My family and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay, and we all had a wonderful experience. Other than that, everything was fantastic
Room Type: Premier King Room with Free wifi

Positive Reviews:
As mentioned in my previous review and the reasons I keep on returning to this property is best value for money compared to any other hotel in aero city,a cluster of hotels including international chain of hotels located 10-15 mins from New Delhi domestic and international terminal. Novotel in my opinion offers everything that other hotels do ,but at best best price as I have had stays in other hotels of aero city as well .
Also the staff is very polite,smiling and helpful.
Foods of different ethnicity are available especially the variety and taste of Indian food is great. The rooms are quite comfortable beds to sleep in . Transfer to airport is also offered on payment mostly unless may be part of booking package.
I plan a return to delhi in 2 days and will stay again with them.

Review Title: A peaceful, refreshing and high quality stay before boarding a plane for a long haul flight!
Negative Reviews:
Check in and check out was very slow. Check out should have its own service desks because it is quicker.
My swipe card stopped working twice during my less than 24 hour stay. I had to stand in long queues to have it reactivated which was frustrating.
Only one side of the bed had a power point. There should be one on each side for when two people stay in the room.
A better quality coffee should be provided in the room.  A Nespresso machine should be standard for a five star hotel. The milk ran out, little cartons would be better.
Positive Reviews:
The staff across all the different services were very friendly and efficient. The room was very comfortable, bright and had a good outlook. The gym, pool and steam room were well maintained, with a visible presence of staff for assistance.
The snack board provided at the bar was a delicious and pleasant surprise and ample in size!
The masala chai tea bags were flavoursome. The other tea options were also good.
There was plenty of bottled drinking water.

Negative Reviews:
This I don't like: 
1- Upon my arrival my room smelled VERY bad. I'm not a complainer in general but it was so bad that for the first time in my life, I went down and asked them to change my room. The second room they gave me was much better but it still smelled bad (a lot less), but this time I just did not want to go and complain again... 
2- The floor was very dusty. Despite the room service, it seems that they don't vacuum everyday (?), The bathroom floor was not clean, the carpet was super dusty...
3- The prices for consumption at the hotel are abusive. For example I paid 680 Rp for a double espresso coffee (7.70 Eu), I paid nearly 20 euros for 2 local beers.
Positive Reviews: The rooms were great size and comfortable. The staff is very friendly. The distance to the airport is great and if you want to go downtown you are near the Metro/Subway/Tube (literally 10 minutes walk). The food in this hotel is much better than most hotels I've stayed in, in Delhi. The restaurant caters to both international and local travelers.

Review Title: We had a very good experience
Negative Reviews:
Two main things were a problem:
1. Though the food was very good it was also very expensive, not just by Indian standards. I am coming from Denmark and the food cost at the hotel is almost the same. There was no other possibility for lower-priced food. 
2. It was almost impossible to catch reception by phone (from the room). Every time I needed something I needed eventually to do down to the reception. 
3. If you are counting on the pool - note that the pool is small and used also for private events.
Positive Reviews: The hotel has nice vibes. The staff is excellent, and they all gave us a feeling of welcome and took care of our needs. The food that was offered for dinner was of very high quality with endless variety. Also, the cafe place downstairs has an amazing coffee and lovely places to seat for meetings. The room was nice and clean and comfortable. Essential amenities are provided and more. Even with the disadvantages overall, I recommend the hotel.
Room Type: Premier King Room with Free wifi

Review Title: Novotel - we'll be back for more!
Negative Reviews: The bellhop and luggage counters are always busy and we had to wait on few occasions to get our needs sorted out. Also their taxi service was super expensive (expected!) - airport drop (only 5 Kms) was Rs. 1800 + taxes for Toyota Innova and it doesn't come with luggage carrier (some stupid rule in Delhi?) so if you have extra-bags that won't fit all in the back then you will have to get a second cab. We were 4 with 4 large suitcases and some smaller items so ended up negotiating with an outside vendor to make two trips (if needed) for Rs.1500 but the guys was able to fit us all without the need for luggage carrier in a single trip.
Positive Reviews:
Good location and good value - particularly if you are looking for 5 star properties near the Delhi airports (both International and Domestic). The main restaurant is buffet style and had sufficient variety to satisfy the adults and kids in the family. Some preparations were hit or miss at times but overall the quality and variety was better than that of the sister Pullman Hotel (more expensive) as we tried their buffet as well and were not impressed. The waiting staff is generally very courteous and helpful and they would listen to your feedback with care and urgency even if they are unable to fix anything. This was kind of a transit hotel for us and the good thing is that we were able to leave some of our heavy luggage with them in their cloak room as we traveled elsewhere on Domestic flights for few days. There was absolutely no extra charge for this facility and it worked out very well for our needs as we had to anyway come back to Delhi to catch the international flight and stayed again in this hotel for the night before the final journey back.
They have spa and heated pool that we saw but didn't have time to try out. The spa and pool is shared with Pullman.
Room Type: Standard King Room with Free WiFi

Review Title: Beautiful hotel facilities near airport to wind down in, pricy for what it was but still nice
Negative Reviews:
The spa itself which I understand is separate to the hotel. I had a decent enough massage which I prebooked and the lady was super polite. Hovewer it was extremely over priced, I live in London and this was above most London spa prices and didn't give you any more in terms of an experience than normal spas I've been to that were half the price. I wouldn't recommend going there for those prices to be honest. Hotel is nice enough, just use the sauna and pool to relax.
Oh and unlimited free water and tea in the room, was a lovely gesture.
Positive Reviews:
Stayed for one night as had a flight the next day. I wanted a spa hotel to indulge myself and the stay was pleasant. The spa facilities were good overall. Had to cross over by the pool to use the sauna and steam room next door (had to ask someone as ones in our hotel were turned off). The sauna was nice, steam room was not working 100%.used the outdoor pool in the evening which was lovely and felt safe for a woman alone, as staff nearby. Also sauna and steam room were gender separated in the changing rooms.
The bed was super comfy and so was the rest of the room. Breakfast was nice but I got an upset stomach, may be down to me becoming relaxed with disinfectant as was the end of my trip. Surprising, as I was fine for over two weeks before. But may be the size of the hotel and the amount of people there.
Had a lovely dinner night before, the service was very attentive and I was feeling super full when I left.
Room Type: Standard King Room with Free WiFi

Negative Reviews: Extremely unaccommodating reception staff. Despite all smiles, they stick to so called 'protocols' and are very inflexible. As our incoming flight arrived at 8 am, we requested an early check in and were told the only option is to book an extra night, and so I did. On our return journey the flight was to leave at 8 am and so we couldn't have the breakfast next morning, we requested to change the inclusive breakfast to dinner instead for the previous night and were told NO! It is unfortunate they hide behind protocols and are inflexible for small costs. This money minded approach turns the whole experience sour and unsatisfying, and we feel unvalued despite the high costs we pay!
Positive Reviews: Good clean facilities, excellent food selection in breakfast and dinner.
Room Type: Standard King Room with Free WiFi

Negativ: "Hospitality"...Dear Novotel, i booked breakfast but can't have it because leaving early. I asked for have dinner instead and of course paying the difference. Not possible. The booked "package" is what it is. Customers Problem. Really that unflexible?
The loud music in the ground floor don`t match and don't make me feel to be in a great hotel. More quiet, relaxed and smooth music would be good. Positiv: Because of that i asked for another room late that evening and they gave me one which was great!
positiv: The room is really great and quiet. A lot space, nice bathroom. Also a really great gym. Many options to spend time in that hotel. The cleaning staff and also the security staff is very kind (meanwhile otherwhere in that hotel staff feels a bit faceless and less welcoming to me).
Good connecting to the airport. Use ola (aprox 100 - 150 r) or Metro (20 r)
I can recommend the hotel. But i will not stay here again next time. Looking for the special service (like in Taj Bengaluru and other) which i always try to test and more relaxed atmosphere.

Negative Reviews: Well, this is the first hotel in my travel history which created so much issue for early check in, given the fact that the hotel is next to the airport where flexibility should be the prime concern. And I can confirm that this is not the norm because I have been routinely doing this during my travels since the airport hotels understand that we do not plan the flight timings. I can also confirm that during my return trip I stayed in Holiday Inn just next to this hotel where I checked in 3-4 hours early (no issues, no charges). Yesterday, I was in Helsinki and I checked out 4 hours later to match with my flight timings at no extra cost. Just to add, I also informed them that I would check out at 5 am the next day to take my flight and this was not an availability issue because they let me check in after I paid half of one night's price. Not a good experience after a long 12 hours flight. I would definitely prefer to avoid Novotel in future.
Room Type: Standard King Room with Free WiFi

Room Type: Standard Twin Room with Free WiFi

Positive Reviews:
I recently stayed at Novotel Delhi and, overall, had a pleasant experience. The hotel itself is clean, well-maintained, and provides a comfortable environment that made my stay enjoyable. The food served was excellent, reflecting the high standards of their culinary team.

However, during my stay, I encountered a significant issue that I would prefer not to detail here. Despite this, I was incredibly impressed with how the situation was handled. Manager Kushal and Chef Amit promptly visited my room to personally apologize. Their professionalism and sincere efforts to make amends were commendable. They not only addressed my concerns but also ensured I was compensated appropriately, which went a long way in turning around my experience.

Moreover, Chef Virender also came to see me, further demonstrating the staff's commitment to guest satisfaction. Thanks to their efforts, what could have been a negative experience was transformed into a positive one. 

The rest of my stay was fantastic. The room was comfortable, the facilities were top-notch, and the service was consistently excellent. I truly enjoyed my time at Novotel Delhi and would recommend it to anyone looking for a great place to stay in the city.
Room Type: Standard King Room with Free WiFi

Positive Reviews:
This is a standing establishment. 
The entire establishment and its common areas are immaculately clean. 
Room 349: It is located on the 3rd floor. The bedroom area, bathroom is separate. The bedroom has a small sitting area. The decoration is contemporary, neat. 
The furniture is elegant. 
The set is bright, very spacious. 
The lighting is well distributed, soft and warm.The spaces are generous. The blackout curtain and acoustic insulation are effective. 
The bedroom, bed linen and towels are impeccably clean. The bedding is of excellent quality. The bathroom is spacious. It has an adjustable spray shower. 
The room is equipped with Wi-Fi, a telephone, air conditioning (efficient and quiet), a kettle, a mini fridge, a safe -box, a large flat screen.
The hotel has several restaurants. The restaurants are spacious and bright. From breakfast or dinner, the restaurants offer a wide variety of catering: continental, Indian, Asian... The culinary proposals are of very good taste quality. The products are of very good quality.
The reception staff, floors, catering... are welcoming, available and of impeccable professionalism. 
A special mention for: Amit, Naman, Ravi, Rishabh and Yogita.
Room Type: Standard Twin Room with Free WiFi

Review Title: Very bad Check in-Check Out experience. F&B was great.
Negative Reviews:
the check in/check out process was truly horrible. 
we arrived at 5pm and didn’t get a room key until 7pm (which I had to bother the check in guy for several times) 
mind you, property check in was 3p - so we had to wait 4 HOURS?!? For our room to be ready. 
also the wait to check in was 20+ minutes 
as expected, the check out process was equally as clunky. 
I had requested hotel shuttle (Rs 1800) which was not on time. also found out it was a total rip off. 
we got an Uber to the airport for Rs 150 after hotel failed to accommodate us. don’t waste your money on their shuttle service. 
also TV did not have one single channel in English.

They are too busy and understaffed I feel. When my wife checked in, we booked an extra bed as we were 2 adults and 2 children. It was all ok and then after a few follow ups, we were advised that there were no beds and sent duvets to sleep on. 

There was no sense of trying for another room for a night or an apology. It was an easy fix I believe. 

Once Shalini got involved the next day, she was able to take quick action and sort it out.

Its one of those hotels that are full of airline crew, wedding parties and unfortunately being a busy business hotel is not the best for families with kids.

Review Title: HORRIBLE AT CHECK IN (STAFFS ARE LIER)
Negative Reviews: As an Australian who had just booked a three-day trip to Delhi, the staff should understand how crucial each visitor's time is. However, the so-called five-star hotel receptionist RAJ destroyed our entire itinerary.The check-in personnel Raj was a liar and a highly unprofessional person. Because of this individual, we unnecessarily wasted one of our day and completely destroyed our plans. The awful check-in experience. I requested numerous times that I arrive at 10 a.m. on October 18 and check out at 5 a.m. on October 21, but I arrived at 12:30 p.m. When I asked for at least one room of two rooms, the check-in counter initially denied, saying that we would have to wait because we had arrived early. After three requests, he finally granted us a room after an hour of waiting. then, my next available room was ours, but he did not provide us of this until 4 PM. Because of this liar, our entire day was wasted. When I arrived at the accommodation, I discovered that both rooms had been vacant for two days, that no guests had been there, and that the check-in staff had been lying about the presence of guests. Is this treatment like a five-star hotel? I then vowed that I wouldn't spend any additional money at this hotel on food or entertainment, choosing instead to eat at a nearby five star properties. I believe the check-in counter employees' smiles were lost on another planet, or they were working longer hours under pressure, or there was a shortage of staff members and insufficient training. Even though one of our room ac units wasn't working, I chose not to report it and instead chose to turn the unit off entirely or request house keeping service for the three days. Rest everthing is okey.. Close to Airport and some staffs are very nice and polite.
Positive Reviews: The Swimming pool, the House keeping staff, the amenities in the room are good, but aircon was bad whatever it did not move more or less then 19.5 degree. Some staffs are really very nice..

Review Title: Please avoid at all costs.. unless you have zero other options.
Negative Reviews:
Staff is extremely rude, the worst I have seen ever in a reputed hotel chain
Right from the people who scan your bags, to the door-persons, to the front desk.. especially the front desk.. absolutely rude and disinterested. Front desk is managed poorly, sometimes 3 members of staff on one counter, instead of serving multiple customers in line. Do not make you feel welcome in the least bit.
I have experienced this almost hostility from the staff each of the times I visit. Unfortunately I am forced to check into this hotel because my hosts book me there.
I was harassed by the front desk because my OCI card did not have my passport number on there!!! What can I do if that is the way an OCI card is!! OCI cards neve have passport numbers on them because it is a lifetime visa! I explained to them that the name and all the info is the same, I was still subject to hostility and multiple phone calls.. all this late at night.
Room service NEVER pick up the phone. You have to call multiple times, sometimes over an hour to get their attention.

Review Title: Disappointed with the service - slow and non attentive staff
Negative Reviews:
This stay was my worse experience with Novotel in all these years. I'm not sure if they are short staffed or it's complacency due to good number of bookings but the service is very slow and it takes forever to get them to do anything. 

1. If you arrive by a morning flight and are waiting to check in (before 12noon) and want to get some food, firstly food in the bar or restaurant is not available before 12noon. On their bar menu they say pizza is available from 11am but when we ordered it at 11.30am we were told we can't order it before 12noon. Despite it clearly mentioned on their menu that it's available from 11am.

2. My colleague accidentally dropped a glass bottle of water near the lift and immediately rushed to inform the guest services to display a sign and have it cleaned up however her and I had to stand near the lift telling hotel guests to be careful for a good 10-12mins before someone from the Novotel team came. We kept going to the guest services desk and reminding the lady a couple of times and she would just say 'please wait we are sending someone' - as if we were employees of the hotel and it was our duty to stand there.

3. My colleague requested for a sanitary napkin at the guest services desk and it took them 20mins to bring her a sanitary. All the time we were told it's on the way. It would have been quicker to go to the 24/7 and buy a pack

4. The check out takes ages. There is no separate desk for check out. So you have to wait in line with guests checking in. And even when you do that and the queue grows, no one jumps to help. Infact while i was waiting, another gentleman walked ahead of me and the lady at the reception did not once tell him to wait his turn. Instead she started doing the formalities. I even requested someone to quicken the process as I had to rush to the airport but no one even looked up from their desk.
Positive Reviews: Clean comfortable room and great location
Room Type: Standard King Room with Free WiFi

Building facade falls apart at some points, needs restoration. Garbage concentrated just behing the bad looking garden, all visible from the room window.

the staff. Abhishek at front desk messed up by giving rooms for my old parents where they had to walk a lot and then could not coordinate between concierge to get my bags moved from old room to new 
Naved the manager promised the room shift with bags moved in 15 mins but when we came back 2.5 hrs later the rooms were not even allocated let alone luggage which was lying in the old room with keys which we had deposited at reception.

several other small issues but this was the main one

Room Type: Standard King Room with Free WiFi

Negative Reviews: Very disappointing stay here. The check-in staff were super slow - we arrived early morning at around 1am and had to queue for 30 minutes to check in, with hardly any staff available. We had requested baby cot to be placed in the room in advance, which the property confirmed twice - via booking and on phone, yet it wasn't placed. We had to wait another hour for it to be readied while the kids were very tired. Not the best experience at an airport hotel unfortunately. The room was super small and not really worth the price. Overall, won't return again.

Review Title: Overall, the stay was pretty much forgettable.
Negative Reviews:
The TV was not working and the cricket match had already started! I called the designated phone number in the hotel and asked to send someone to fix it but only after 3 calls to the number and half an hour later one person showed up who had no clue as to what to do. He tried for about 20 minutes to 'fix' it. He kept saying that he could only start a particular channel when a customer requested it. After some time he said since everyone in the hotel was watching the match the server was down. Getting frustrated with his excuses and incompetence, I said I would like to make a complaint to the manager and the guy called his senior who fixed the issue in about 10 minutes by getting a set box from another room. 

The veg grilled sandwich was awful and not worth the money that it cost. The basil and tomato soup was good.
Positive Reviews:
The room was clean but small and cramped. 
One of the people at the front desk said he would arrange for a bagged breakfast of sandwich since were had planned to check out by 6am. But we got nothing.

Review Title: Good location but not recommended for hospitality and rooms.
Negative Reviews:
On checkin, the staff were not pleasant and were attending to other guests while checking me in, this did make me angry. The pool view room, that I booked, was not available and the explanation was hilarious!  Hotel staff explained: "Sorry,  but those rooms were already taken by the earlier arriving guests".  That is totally unacceptable and pathetic as this booking was made 3 months ago and there was communication between the hotel and myself in the days leading up to the day.
Lunchtime buffet selection was limited, you're better off and it's cheaper to go for their a la carte menu, which has a much more interesting offering. For dinner options,  best to go to the mall,  only 2 minutes walk,  and enjoy the delights on offer there. Kingsize room was small and the shower screen did nit work. 
 My checkout experience was also slow and miserable. I wouldn't be comfortable booking this hotel again.
Positive Reviews:
Was a August visit stay for 1 night before catching flight back to UK.  Location only 10mins drive to T3 departure and a pleasant night bars, shopping and food court mall 2 minutes walk for evening entertainment. Their pool and gym is good.
The hotels taxi/transfer service is in a clean car and convenient to and from the airport,  but you will need to pay premium price for it -  Rps 1,200. Found out that Uber wpuld have charged us Rps 550 !
Room Type: Standard King Room with Free WiFi

Review Title: If it was not for the location close to airport - would probably avoid.
Negative Reviews:
1./ Lobby doesn't have functioning air conditioning and check in staff take an inordinate amount of time to check in- probably filling God know what documenation and doing over optimization in room allotment - 50 min to check in at peak time.
2./ If you don't like the room service menu - you are in for a tough surprise. The hotel does not allow delivery staff to come close to reception so you have to go a good 100m away to gates and outside to get any food deliveries. 
3./ Same goes for any packages you may need to receive during your stay. 
4./ Staff generally do not know the limits between being courteous and over bearing, especially while dropping the luggage- even when tip has been paid.
Room Type: Standard King Room with Free WiFi

Review Title: Totally disappointed, as it was our favorite hotel in aero city.
Negative Reviews:
Quality of service.
- Front Office extremely slow.
- Room Service extremely slow. It takes ages to get the order.
- It is very hard to get connected to the person when you dial 0. Either they drop the line or they don't answer.
The quality of service has badly deteriorated. It is not the same quality, as it used to be previously. We used to love this property for their quality of service.

I blame the GM of the property, as he should personally be looking into all departments to make sure they provide quality services and not to lose their clients. Next time we are not going to stay in Novotel anymore.

The staff in the main restaurant is exceptionally good. They are professionals and know their job very well. I would like to thanks F&B Director/Manager for grooming and training the staff.
Positive Reviews: Location. Very near to the airport.
Room Type: Standard King Room with Free WiFi

Negative Reviews: Main reason for my low rating is that Novotel mailed me a confirmation for my request for an extra bed for my 6 year old kid 2 days before my travel. I reminded them when i checked in, got a confirmation, then I called and said that the extra bed could be put in the room even if we wouldnt be in the room, got a confirmation. Then we went out for dinner and got back after 3h and found that there was no bed. This followed a lot of calls with housekeeping and their answer was that they didnt have any extra beds. Until 11, the calls continued and every time, I had to explain the issue to a different person and nothing worked. Half the time, housekeeping did not lift the call. We had an early morning wakeup to catch a flight and couldnt go anywhere at 11.30 in the night with a kid. So, we ended up staying up half the night with this inconvenience. Very disappointed and will not return. I dont expect this in a 5 star hotel.
Positive Reviews: Transport to and from airport worked well. Hotel is clean and has good sound proof rooms.
Room Type: Standard King Room with Free WiFi

Review Title: Poor experience overall, not sure why this is a five star hotel.
Negative Reviews: On booking.com it showed pictures of the bathroom having baths however no rooms within this hotel had a bath unless you booked a suite (which was not made clear and very misleading on the website). Also the saunas were not working and the ‘spa’ does not exist- it’s associated with the Pullman hotel next door, not this hotel. In addition, I was suffering with a cough and got told by reception they would bring cough sweets up to my room and was required to pay 200 rupees. However no cough sweets were sent. Very disappointed with the stay and very poor staff for a five star hotel.

Review Title: Not a good experience at all.
Negative Reviews:
The poor rating I'm giving for mainly 2 reasons as mentioned below:
1. I called around 12:50 AM to the reception to collect my baggage as my flight was at 3:35 AM, I wanted to reach the airport by/ before 1:30. Reception told me he's sending someone in 10 mins, no one comes. after 15 mins I called again then they told me to send in another 10 mins. no one comes again. Then finally my wife went below to ask them personally and they were free and came just after that but by that time I already lost around 30 mins. What is the use to pay more than 10K/ night for 5 star hotel if the room service is not upto the mark and caused us to delay reaching the airport where we faced issue due to late arrival.
2. Finally when we went down with luggague after around 45 mins of delay we asked for the CAB which must be there already as I already requested at the time of booking and when I 1st called them but no sign of CAB. They asked me about the money for cab beforehand to submit and when I gave them 1500 rs Cash they were not having 150 rs change to give me back. 5 Star hotel doesnt have 150 rs change, can you believe it? Though then I paid by card but still when you're already rushing this small things can impact a lot. After it they called for CAB which came after 5 mins and we didnt get any response untill we asked about it.

It caused us a delay of overall 1 hour and caused trouble at the airport too with a huge line at immigration and difficulty to clear the queues.

So, overall not a good experience at all and never gonna go to this hotel again and will not recommend to any of my friends and family members. It was my 4th stay in Aerocity this year and other 3 hotels (IBIS, Holiday Inn, Plaza) were far better in hospitality. I usually dont provide the feedback but this time due to all trouble and delays I had to with the root cause.

Review Title: DO NOT STAY HERE, THE DUTY MANAGER NAVEEN LIES.
Negative Reviews:
on arrival after having booked on booking.com I was told the price of the room was actually closer to £100 rather than the £78 on booking. I had chosen a cheaper hotel as was just staying from 6pm to 3am. I was also told the airport transport would be £20 (it is less than 5 mins from the airport, a ride which would have cost 200irs (£2) in a normal taxi. When I bought this up I was told by the guy at reception that I needed to take it up with booking.com and basically that it is what it is and I should just take a normal taxi then. when I advised him as a girl travelling alone in Delhi in a normal taxi wasn’t really sensible, he shrugged his shoulders and said no it’s not safe. I asked to speak to the manager and was told he was busy. I asked that he call my room. He did not. After calling down 3 times I eventually spoke with Naveen the duty manager and told him what had happened. He quite rudely said well what do you want from me then? I was taken aback and asked him what he meant, to which he replied well you want something, what is it? 
Eventually he advised that he had not taken payment for transport I required to the airport and therefore would make that complimentary. All then seemed well and resolved….
At 3am I went down to find no car, however the reception also disputed the fact it was complementary until they read the notes on the computer 🤦🏽‍♀️. 
I have now reached my destination and 2 days after leaving have noted the hotel has now requested payment from my bank for the so called complementary airport transport, which was documented as so by the duty manager Naveen. 
I am shocked at the way I was spoken to, about the misinformation on cost, and the fact that I was advise airport transport on my return would be given as complementary but was not and they have slyly requested payment 2 days after I have left. 
Unfortunately the staff here are liars and rude. 
My advice spend a bit more and stay in a hotel that knows good Indian hospitality.
Positive Reviews: the property is presentable and closely located to the airport HOWEVER, and I say this as a frequent traveller and frequenter to good delhi hotels, DO NOT stay here.
Room Type: Premier King Room with Free wifi

Negative Reviews: 5 star property, charging 5 star prices, but cannot deliver a 5 star experience.  I had dinner in the property's main restaurant as a cockroach scurried by my feet - this is a restaurant with a BUFFET, food that is openly out, as they have roaches crawling around the restaurant.  In addition, during Delhi's primary tourist season - the winter months - this property's HVAC/heating could not keep up with the cold weather.  I paid USD 250/night to stay up until 3am, cold in my room, with the on duty manager apologizing that there was nothing he could do, the HVAC/heating could not keep up with the cold weather outside.  Then why am I paying you USD 250/night...???  What a waste of money!!!  I asked to personally speak about these issues with the General Manager the next day, with no follow-up by the GM, at all.  If you are expecting 5 star amenities and service given the price point of this property, you will be deeply disappointed.  Stay elsewhere, and get your money's worth!!!!

Review Title: Leaves a lot to be desired from the stars it has on it's mast
Negative Reviews: Check in took 35 mins to be exact from the moment we walked through the doors with family. Lot of fumbling around for a simple straightforward booking.com checkin. Got an email and message twice that my card was invalid before I got there and each time I updated online only to find out they didn't even try charging the card. Fantastic. Had 2 rooms for us. Luggage and the process to take luggage upstairs to the room took another 30 mins while I was waiting in the lobby and staff were busy handling luggage for guests who rolled in after us. One of the room had a constant light blinking from the smoke alarms and had a lot of mosquitoes. So much so that we had to ask for a mosquito repellent because the kids started scratching from mozzie bites. Paid cash for the reservation and had some balance left that hotel had to pay me on checkout since they didn't had change. Guess what...next morning they told me they are less on change so will I accept a lower amount. What was I supposed to do..miss a $3k flight for a few bucks change? Seriously though will you guys accept if I come there next time and say I am a bit short on cash? I usually stay at Hyatt or Radisson but thought this time will give them a try. Never again if this is the experience that people get at Novotel. Oh BTW for anyone looking to get a cab to the airport do yourself a favour don't go through them where they will charge you 2100 for a 10 mins drive..get an Ola for less than 1/10 the price.
Positive Reviews: Location is fantastic if you are catching a flight or getting off a flight and don't want to get caught in endless traffic in Delhi. Hotel itself has a nice ambience but that's about it.
Room Type: Standard King Room with Free WiFi

After that he agreed to return my money but then still charged about $100 more than the price in my booking and in his own calculations (of course, all the taxes were calculated, but still $100 more). I had no time to continue this discussion and left. Of course, the hotel did not return any extra charged money.

THIS WAS THE MOST DISAPPOINTING EXPERIENCE I EVER HAD AT ANY HOTEL.

I am very disappointed with their services. Before check in, I called them multiple times to book airport pickup. None picked any phone. I then sent an email and in their automated response I found some numbers where I could call and book. This was very disappointing. At the reception, I had to wait for so long to check in. The worst part was check out. I had called them in the morning for a cab to drop at airport at 12. At around  11.40, I called them to send trolley to our room. Then the wait begins. Someone came after 40 mins and we had followed up 4 times in between.  I got a call at 1210 when they asked my checked out time, I had to tell them I was waiting for the trolley for so long. We even decided to take our luggage down ourselves. We started doing it then someone showed up and moved our luggage. At the reception the wait game begins again. They did not even have the cab ready. They were not even sharing the correct information about the status. I even had asked them to confirm or else I could book Ola or Uber. Finally, the cab came and somehow my relatives made it to the flight

Front desk person (Nishant) told us during check-in that he was giving us a "superior" room but it turned out to be too far from the only four elevators in the entire hotel. We then requested to be moved to a room which was closer to the elevators. The wash basin in this "new" room was clogged so had to call help to get that sorted out. Decided to try Asian cuisine at Honk but the food was a BIG let down. The wonton soup tasted like it only had MSG as its main ingredient. To make matters worse, the stir fried veggies had a dead fly in it which we found out after having taken quite a few bites of it. Spoke to the manager (Manish) who was very apologetic but that experience ruined our evening to say the least. 
This was our first time at Novotel and will most likely be our last.

Negative Reviews:
I stayed at this property for 2 nights 3 days. I booked it via the booking.com and selected the “pay at property” option. When I was paying the amount, the front desk assistant asked me for extra money which was around 19000₹ something. However, as per my hotel vouchers it was 16632₹ (included taxes). Though, I was aware of my amount. so I asked him to explain and he tried to make me fool. Gladly, Which he couldn’t. After my checkout I noticed that he charged extra 500₹. So this is how this property is trying to looting their guest.

This is not a 5star property at all. They only have big spacious area. Rooms are not up to the mark. Novotel doesn’t have a good quality of table in their rooms. Toiletries were not there I had to ask them for brush,bathroom sleepers etc. Mini bar was empty. No wafers at all. Coffee mug was chipped. 
On the 1st floor of this property, only cigarette smells everywhere. 
It was very hard to get a table for breakfast. 

It was my birthday, I sent them reminders several time to arrange a complimentary cake. After 3-4 calls they sent it. Thankyou Novotel for making my day pathetically special.
